sentence: To determine if there exists an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for some integer \( n \), we start by analyzing the expression \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \).
sentence-category-reason: Restates the goal and begins interpreting what needs analyzing, but the core is identifying and restating the mathematical object of study, setting up the problem.
Announces the first concrete action or approach to proceed (modulo 9 analysis). This outlines the intended next step.

sentence: We will evaluate \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) for \( n = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, 8 \) since these residues cover all possible cases for \( n \mod 9 \).
sentence-category-reason: Explicitly declares the current step to be carried out—checking each residue class for n mod 9. This is planning how to cover all cases.

sentence:
\[
\begin{align*}
n \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(1) + 3(1) + 7 \equiv 13 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(4) + 3(2) + 7 \equiv 25 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(9) + 3(3) + 7 \equiv 43 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(16) + 3(4) + 7 \equiv 67 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(25) + 3(5) + 7 \equiv 97 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(36) + 3(6) + 7 \equiv 133 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(49) + 3(7) + 7 \equiv 175 \equiv 4 \pmod{9}, \\
n \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 3(64) + 3(8) + 7 \equiv 223 \equiv 7 \pmod{9}.
sentence-category-reason: Performs detailed calculations for all residue classes as planned—concrete evaluation and computation.
Closes the displayed calculation; this is the final part of the calculation rather than a separate logical step.
Summarizes the computational result in a concrete, deduced manner, still as part of executing the computational step.

sentence: Next, we consider the possible values of \( x^3 \mod 9 \).
sentence-category-reason: Announces the next step by stating what will be considered next (x^3 mod 9 analysis). This indicates a plan for the subsequent calculation.

sentence:
We compute \( x^3 \mod 9 \) for \( x = 0, 1, 2, \ldots, 8 \): \[
\begin{align*}
x \equiv 0 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 1 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 2 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 3 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 27 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 4 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 64 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 5 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 125 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 6 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 216 \equiv 0 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 7 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 343 \equiv 1 \pmod{9}, \\
x \equiv 8 \pmod{9} & : \quad x^3 \equiv 512 \equiv 8 \pmod{9}.
sentence-category-reason: Describes the explicit computation of x^3 mod 9 for each case, which is actually carrying out the planned analysis.
Closes the calculation table; this is part of the computation being detailed rather than a new logical action.

sentence: The possible values of \( x^3 \mod 9 \) are \( 0, 1, 8 \).
sentence-category-reason: Summarizes the computation's result, directly stating derived possibilities for x^3 mod 9, thus still an implementing (summative) step.

sentence: Since \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 4 \) or \( 7 \pmod{9} \) and \( x^3 \equiv 0, 1, 8 \pmod{9} \), there is no overlap between the possible values of \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \mod 9 \) and \( x^3 \mod 9 \).
sentence-category-reason: Analyzes and compares the two possible sets of values, inferring that there is no overlap; this is a logical deduction based on previous results and not new computation.

sentence: Therefore, there does not exist an integer \( x \) such that \( x^3 = 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) for any integer \( n \).
sentence-category-reason: Draws and states the conclusion resulting from the completed logical reasoning—asserts the result derived, not just reporting the answer.
Explicitly states the answer (No) to the problem, in clear answer-delivering form.
